channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024120227
item.description:
Report E-2024120227

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0540 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSL(OLD). It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Printing Ink released from a metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024120201
item.description:
Report E-2024120201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: SIKESTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly unloading freight that resulted in the drum being damaged. The material released was RE 2k 20 Extender. The release material impacted the trailer floor and concrete dock. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120122
item.description:
Report E-2024120122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 5 gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from a forklift. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight's contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
